maml:description.maml:para: Adds a training notification to an existing campaign.
Adds a training notification to an existing campaign.
The campaign Id of the existing training.
TBD.
An email address that is used in place of the primary (if not available).
Enables the notification. Enabled by default.
Specifies which type of email notification will be used.
Sets the amount of days to be used for a reminder. Can be used with the `MessageType` parameter to determine before and after due dates. Example: send a reminder 1 day after enrollment
Sets the amount of days to send a recurring reminder. Example: resend a reminder every 3 days.
The `User` email template Id used to send notifications to the user.
The `Admin` email template Id used to send notifications to the administrator.
The `Manager` email template Id used to send notifications to the manager.
The method used to deliver the notification. Currently, `email` is the only option (used by default).
The `Admin` email template Id used to send notifications to the administrator.
The campaign Id of the existing training.
The method used to deliver the notification. Currently, `email` is the only option (used by default).
The `User` email template Id used to send notifications to the user.
Enables the notification. Enabled by default.
An email address that is used in place of the primary (if not available).
The `Manager` email template Id used to send notifications to the manager.
Specifies which type of email notification will be used.
Sets the amount of days to be used for a reminder. Can be used with the `MessageType` parameter to determine before and after due dates. Example: send a reminder 1 day after enrollment
Sets the amount of days to send a recurring reminder. Example: resend a reminder every 3 days.
TBD.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a notification to an existing training campaign.

maml:description.maml:para: Deactivates (closes) a phishing campaign.
Deactivates a phishing campaign.

The Id of the phishing campaign.

maml:description.maml:para: Closes a training campaign.

The Id of the training campaign.

maml:description.maml:para: Connects to the KnowBe4 Partner Account portal.
Connects to the KnowBe4 Partner Account portal using SAML Single Sign-On authentication.
The email address used to log into the account.
The email address used to log into the account.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command connects and authenticates to the KnowBe4 Partner.

maml:description.maml:para: Disconnects the current managed client account session.
This cmdlet disconnects the current client session. This is useful when you need to run commands in another client context.
This cmdlet returns all account information for the current managed account.
This cmdlet returns all account information for the current managed account.
Specifies whether the current signed-in user is the owner. Default is `true`.
Specifies whether the current signed-in user is the owner. Default is `true`.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns all account information for the current managed account you are signed into.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns all allowed client domains.
Returns all allowed client domains.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns all current listed domains within the managed account.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns all managed accounts.
Returns all managed accounts. You can filter the results by searching for a particular client name.
This specifies how many results you want returned. Default is 25 (per page).
The page number you want returned.
This specifies which client name you want to search for.
The current status of the managed client account.
The current billing type of the managed account.
The field in which to sort by.
The sort direction of all returned results.
TBD. Default value is `ALL`.
Include archived users. Default is `false`.
The current billing type of the managed account.
TBD. Default value is `ALL`.
The page number you want returned.
This specifies how many results you want returned. Default is 25 (per page).
This specifies which client name you want to search for.
The sort direction of all returned results.
The field in which to sort by.
The current status of the managed client account.
Include archived users. Default is `false`.

This specifies the context in which the information is requested. Default is `USER`.

This cmdlet returns basic information about the training campaign form including groups, purchased courses, account seats, and policies.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new phishing campaign.
This cmdlet creates a new phishing campaign.
Specifies which days the company operates.
- `0` = Sunday
- `1` = Monday
- `2` = Tuesday
- `3` = Wednesday
- `4` = Thursday
- `5` = Friday
- `6` = Saturday
The time the business ends for the day. Example: `17:00`
The date in which the campaign will initially run.
The time in which the campaign will run at.
TBD.
Specifies the difficulty rating for the phishing template.
The sub-domain to be used in the `reply-to` address. This is typically the default (primary) domain name. Example: `contoso`
The Id of the domain to be used in the `reply-to` email.
Specific groups to be included in the phishing campaign.
The phishing template categories to be used in the campaign.
TBD.
Specifies whether or not to email account admins after each phishing test.
The time the business opens. Example: `08:00`
Sets the amount of days to send phishing tests.
Specifies the type of unit to use (`DAYS`, `WEEKS`, `MONTHS`). Used with the `SendingDuration` parameter.
Specifies whether or not to spread phishing tests over a specific time frame instead of all at once.
Store all user replies.
The specified time zone to use for the phishing campaign.
Track out of office replies and count them as failures.
Keeps track of user replies to all phishing emails.
The length of time to track phishing email failures. Max is 6 months.
Specifies the type of unit to use (`DAYS`, `WEEKS`, `MONTHS`). Used with the `TrackingDuration` parameter.
The Id of the group you want to add users to when they fail a phishing test.
The `User` email template Id used to send notifications to the user.
Determines how often the campaign will run.
Specifies whether or not to hide the phishing campaign from reports. Hidden campaigns will not impact risk scores.
Specifies a landing page Id to replace the default landing pages associated with email templates and the Account Settings.
Specifies whether or not to send phishing emails in the users's language.
The name of the phishing campaign.
Specifies which days the company operates.
- `0` = Sunday
- `1` = Monday
- `2` = Tuesday
- `3` = Wednesday
- `4` = Thursday
- `5` = Friday
- `6` = Saturday
The time the business ends for the day. Example: `17:00`
The time the business opens. Example: `08:00`
The Id of the group you want to add users to when they fail a phishing test.
The `User` email template Id used to send notifications to the user.
Determines how often the campaign will run.
Specifies whether or not to hide the phishing campaign from reports. Hidden campaigns will not impact risk scores.
Specifies a landing page Id to replace the default landing pages associated with email templates and the Account Settings.
Specifies whether or not to send phishing emails in the users's language.
The name of the phishing campaign.
The date in which the campaign will initially run.
The time in which the campaign will run at.
TBD.
Specifies the difficulty rating for the phishing template.
The sub-domain to be used in the `reply-to` address. This is typically the default (primary) domain name. Example: `contoso`
The Id of the domain to be used in the `reply-to` email.
Specific groups to be included in the phishing campaign.
The phishing template categories to be used in the campaign.
TBD.
Specifies whether or not to email account admins after each phishing test.
Sets the amount of days to send phishing tests.
Specifies the type of unit to use (`DAYS`, `WEEKS`, `MONTHS`). Used with the `SendingDuration` parameter.
Specifies whether or not to spread phishing tests over a specific time frame instead of all at once.
Store all user replies.
The specified time zone to use for the phishing campaign.
Track out of office replies and count them as failures.
Keeps track of user replies to all phishing emails.
The length of time to track phishing email failures. Max is 6 months.
Specifies the type of unit to use (`DAYS`, `WEEKS`, `MONTHS`). Used with the `TrackingDuration` parameter.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$phishingCampaign = @{ BusinessDays = 1,2,3,4,5 BusinessHoursEndHour = '17:00' BusinessHoursStartHour = '08:00' TimeZone = 'PACIFIC_TIME_US_CANADA' ClickedGroupId = 3590820 Name = 'Phishing Campaign' FrequencyPeriod = 'BIWEEK' NextRunDate = '2022-11-16' NextRunTime = '15:30' SelectedTemplateCategories = 1252 ReplyDomainPrefix = 43 ReplyPhishDomainId = 'contoso' StoreReplyContent = 'true' TrackReplies = 'true' }
New-KB4PhishingCampaign @phishingCampaign

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new phishing campaign with the specified values.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new training campaign.
This cmldlet creates a new training campaign.
The name of the training campaign.

This automatically enrolls users who are new to the console if the `AllUsers` parameter is set to `true`. This also applies to selected groups. If this option is set to `true`, users who are added to selected groups will\ automatically be enrolled.
Allows users to complete the training after the due date.
Allows users to take an optional survey at the end of the training.
Allows users to leave comments for the optional content survey (if enabled) after they have completd the training.
Specifies which training course will be used for the training campaign.
Specifies which groups to be included in the training campaign.
Users that complete all of their assignments will be removed from the selected groups.
Adds users to specific groups when assignments are completed.
Enrolls all users to the assigned training.
This specifies whether to make the campaign duration relative, date specific, or have no end date at all.
The date at which to start the training campaign.
The time at which to start the training campaign.
The specific date the campaign ends.
The specific time the campaign ends.
The specified time zone to use for the training campaign.
The amount of days, weeks, or months the user will have to complete the assigned training.
Specifies the type of unit to use (`DAYS`, `WEEKS`, `MONTHS`). Used with the `EnrollmentDuration` parameter.
Used for `Remedial Training` campaigns only. This option resets a user's progress if enrolled in the campaign.
Specifies whether notifications will be created. Dynamic parameters are instantiated when this parameter is used.
Dynamic parameters:
- `[int64] TimeStamp` - TBD.
- `[string] Enabled` - Enables the notification. Enabled by default.
- `[string] MessageType` - Specifies which type of email notification will be used. Reference the `Add-KB4TrainingNotifcation` for types.
- `[object] OffsetNumDays` - Sets the amount of days to be used for a reminder. Can be used with the `MessageType` parameter to determine before and after due dates.
- `[object] RescheduleOffset` - Sets the amount of days to send a reocurring reminder.
- `[int] EmailTemplateId` - The `User` email template Id used to send notifications to the user.
- `[object] AdminEmailTemplateId` - The `Admin` email template Id used to send notifications to the administrator.
- `[object] ManagerEmailTemplateId` - The `Manager` email template Id used to send notifications to the manager.
- `[string] DeliveryMethod` - The method used to deliver the notification. Currently, `email` is the only option (used by default).
- `[string] FallBackEmail` - An email address that is used in place of the primary (if not available).
Adds users to specific groups when assignments are completed.
Enrolls all users to the assigned training.
Allows users to complete the training after the due date.
Allows users to leave comments for the optional content survey (if enabled) after they have completd the training.
Allows users to take an optional survey at the end of the training.

This automatically enrolls users who are new to the console if the `AllUsers` parameter is set to `true`. This also applies to selected groups. If this option is set to `true`, users who are added to selected groups will\ automatically be enrolled.
The specific date the campaign ends.
The specific time the campaign ends.
This specifies whether to make the campaign duration relative, date specific, or have no end date at all.
The amount of days, weeks, or months the user will have to complete the assigned training.
Specifies the type of unit to use (`DAYS`, `WEEKS`, `MONTHS`). Used with the `EnrollmentDuration` parameter.
The name of the training campaign.
Specifies whether notifications will be created. Dynamic parameters are instantiated when this parameter is used.
Dynamic parameters:
- `[int64] TimeStamp` - TBD.
- `[string] Enabled` - Enables the notification. Enabled by default.
- `[string] MessageType` - Specifies which type of email notification will be used. Reference the `Add-KB4TrainingNotifcation` for types.
- `[object] OffsetNumDays` - Sets the amount of days to be used for a reminder. Can be used with the `MessageType` parameter to determine before and after due dates.
- `[object] RescheduleOffset` - Sets the amount of days to send a reocurring reminder.
- `[int] EmailTemplateId` - The `User` email template Id used to send notifications to the user.
- `[object] AdminEmailTemplateId` - The `Admin` email template Id used to send notifications to the administrator.
- `[object] ManagerEmailTemplateId` - The `Manager` email template Id used to send notifications to the manager.
- `[string] DeliveryMethod` - The method used to deliver the notification. Currently, `email` is the only option (used by default).
- `[string] FallBackEmail` - An email address that is used in place of the primary (if not available).
Users that complete all of their assignments will be removed from the selected groups.
Used for `Remedial Training` campaigns only. This option resets a user's progress if enrolled in the campaign.
Specifies which training course will be used for the training campaign.
Specifies which groups to be included in the training campaign.
The date at which to start the training campaign.
The time at which to start the training campaign.
The specified time zone to use for the training campaign.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$trainingCampaign = @{ Name = "Remedial Training" AutoEnroll = 'true' StartCampaignAtDate = "2022-11-16" StartCampaignAtTime = "08:00" EndCampaignAtDate = 'null' EndCampaignAtTime = 'null' TimeZone = 'PACIFIC_TIME_US_CANADA' EnrollmentDuration = 1 EnrollmentDurationType = "WEEKS" ResetAutoEnrollments = 'true' AllowPastDueCompletions = 'false' AllowSurveys = 'false' AllowSurveyComments = 'false' TrackScores = 'true' SelectedContent = 4113634 SelectedGroups = 3590820 RemovePassedFromGroups = 3590820 AddPassedToGroups = 0 AllUsers = 'false' EndCampaignOption = "RELATIVE" }
New-KB4TrainingCampaign @trainingCampaign

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new training campaign with the specified values.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a phishing campaign.
Removes a phishing campaign.
The Id of the phishing campaign.
The Id of the phishing campaign.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes a specific phishing campaign.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a training campaign.
Removes a phishing campaign.
The Id of the training campaign.
The Id of the training campaign.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes a specific training campaign.

maml:description.maml:para: Logs into a managed client account (session).
This cmdlet allows you to sign into a managed account and sets the session context to that client.
The Id of the account owner. This Id is authorized to sign into the managed account.
The Id can be found under `accountOwner` using the `Get-KB4ManagedAccount` cmdlet.
The Id of the account owner. This Id is authorized to sign into the managed account.
The Id can be found under `accountOwner` using the `Get-KB4ManagedAccount` cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command signs into the specified managed account using the owner Id of the account.

maml:description.maml:para: Shows or hides a phishing domain.
This cmdlet shows or hides a phishing domain. Once the domain is hidden, it will not be available for use in campaigns.
The Id of the phishing domain to show or hide.
The Id of the phishing domain to show or hide.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command hides a specific phishing domain from being used in campaigns.
